summary.p: The text (U4) is complete in 12 chapters.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (April 2019).

collation.desc: 1 folio = Title Page (additional). No foliation. Verso blank. Hand #1.
1 folio = Civatarumōttirakāviyam: Table of Contents. No foliation. Hand #2.
1 folio = guard leaf. No foliation. Blank recto verso.
283 folios = Civatarumōttirakāviyam: Mūlam & Urai. Tamil foliation 1‒283. Hand #2.

additions.desc: Shelfmark sticker (Société Asiatique?), written in black ink and crossed-out in red ink: 518 (f[1]r).
Current BnF shelfmark sticker, covering an earlier sticker: INDIEN 14 (f[1]r).

origin.origDate: Dated to circa 1730 by Vinson (1868) and to 1730 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds (presumably palaeographical and material analysis arguments). Not after 1854, since part of the collection of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854), bequested in 1855 to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868).

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequested by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 3, no. 14.
Rosny, Léon de. 1868. La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In Variétés orientales, 177‒224. Paris: Maisonneuve.

Vinson, Julien. 1868. Manuscrits tamouls. Proofreadings of the catalogue for Tamoul 1-204 (old shelfmark). Printed by the atelier oriental de l’Imprimerie nationale. BnF “4-IMPROR-77 (B)”. — See p. 3, no. 14. — The same proofreadings with black ink handwritten corrections are found in Vinson et al. (1866-, f1-f49).
